Class CAConstantsWS

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ejbca.core.protocol.ws.objects.CAConstantsWS

  • public class CAConstantsWS
extends java.lang.Object
    Property keys for creation of CAs via WS.
    Version:
    $Id: CAConstantsWS.java 26057 2017-06-22 08:08:34Z anatom $

    • Field Detail

      • CAKEYPURPOSE_CERTSIGN_STRING

        public static final java.lang.String CAKEYPURPOSE_CERTSIGN_STRING
        Certificate signing key alias
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CAKEYPURPOSE_CRLSIGN_STRING

        public static final java.lang.String CAKEYPURPOSE_CRLSIGN_STRING
        Certificate Revocation List (CRL) signing key alias. Must be the same as the certificate signing key.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CAKEYPURPOSE_DEFAULT_STRING

        public static final java.lang.String CAKEYPURPOSE_DEFAULT_STRING
        Default key. If any of the other aliases are not specified, this will be used in their place. Must be an RSA key if decryption key aliases are not specified.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CAKEYPURPOSE_HARDTOKENENCRYPT_STRING

        public static final java.lang.String CAKEYPURPOSE_HARDTOKENENCRYPT_STRING
        Used for decryption of hard token data (e.g. PUK code). Must be an RSA key.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CAKEYPURPOSE_KEYENCRYPT_STRING

        public static final java.lang.String CAKEYPURPOSE_KEYENCRYPT_STRING
        Used for decryption of key recovery data. Must be an RSA key.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CAKEYPURPOSE_TESTKEY_STRING

        public static final java.lang.String CAKEYPURPOSE_TESTKEY_STRING
        Test signing key. Used by health-check.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • POLICYID

        public static final java.lang.String POLICYID
        The policy ID can be 'null' if no Certificate Policy extension should be present, or\nobjectID as '2.5.29.32.0' or objectID and cpsurl as '2.5.29.32.0 http://foo.bar.com/mycps.txt'. You can add multiple policies such as '2.5.29.32.0 http://foo.bar.com/mycps.txt 1.1.1.1.1 http://foo.bar.com/111cps.txt'.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
